result.execSummary:
The defendant Meliena Marie Zacharias was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Upon successful completion of ALL terms and conditions of probation the court will authorize expungement under 973.015.

Defendant Meliena Marie Zacharias in court with attorney Reyna Ivonne Morales.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
AS TO EACH COUNT:
Statements by each counsel and defendant as to sentencing. Court sentenced the defendant to serve 7 months in the House of Correction; credit for 1 days served, concurrent.  Court STAYED sentences and placed defendant on PROBATION for 24 MONTHS, concurrent with the following conditions:
-No further violations of the law.
-Maintain employment.
-Other counseling needs to be determined.
-Perform 50 HOURS of community service at a non-profit agency.( TOTAL of 100 hours)
-Pay victim witness surcharge and all costs, assessments and surcharges. 
-Pay restitution in the amount of $3449.80 to US BANK, PO Box 650, Milwaukee, WI 53278.  
Failure to pay all costs, assessments, surcharges and restitution  will result in CIVIL JUDGMENT.
Upon successful completion of ALL terms and conditions of probation the court will authorize expungement under 973.015.
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.

Attorney Enku Edgar Lin in court.  Alex Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for sentencing hearing. Defendant is unable to appear in court today as she has no transportation to court. Defense counsel requested a warrant be stayed. State does not object. Court issued but STAYED a warrant until the next court date. Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for February 1, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Meliena Marie Zacharias in court with attorney Enku Edgar Lin who appeared via phone.  Sara Nicole Volden Schroeder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for sentencing hearing. Defense counsel is ill and unable to appear in court. Court granted defense request for adjournment. Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 12, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Plea hearing proceeded. Defendant sworn in.

As to COUNTS 1 & 2 on the Amended Information-
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum, and Jury Instructions received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty.  Judgments of conviction entered.
  
State requested an adjourned sentencing date to complete victim notification. Court granted State's request. Court converted the trial date to a sentencing date. Case adjourned to Branch 25. Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 16, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Meliena Marie Zacharias in court with Solomon Gatton under the student practice rule and under the supervision of attorney Enku Edgar Lin.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp on behalf of Sara Schroeder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for final pretrial. Parties have reached a resolution in this matter. State placed negotiations on the record. State filed an Amended Information. Defendant charged as follows:

COUNT 1- Theft (Value Not Exceeding $2,500), contrary to sec. 943.20(1)(a) and (3)(a), 939.51(3)(a) Wis. Stats., a Class A Misdemeanor. 

COUNT 2- Theft (Value Not Exceeding $2,500), contrary to sec. 943.20(1)(a) and (3)(a), 939.51(3)(a) Wis. Stats., a Class A Misdemeanor.
Restitution worksheet with attachment received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.

Defendant Meliena Marie Zacharias in court with attorney Enku Edgar Lin.  Sara Nicole Volden Schroeder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for plea hearing. Parties have resolved this matter with a deferred prosecution agreement, but defense counsel is unable to proceed on one of the conditions. Defendant recently lost her job and is unable to pay the restitution in the time period specified in the DPA. Due to the delays in this case, Court ordered final pretrial and jury trial dates be set. Parties still anticipate a resolution in this matter. Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Final pre-trial scheduled for November 2, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for December 16, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Meliena Marie Zacharias in court with attorney Enku Edgar Lin.  Sara Nicole Volden Schroeder on behalf of James Frisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for plea hearing. Parties are still in negotiations and request an adjourned plea date. Defense counsel advised the court this matter may resolve with a deferred prosecution agreement. Court allowed one final adjournment. Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Plea hearing scheduled for September 29, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Meliena Marie Zacharias in court with attorney Enku Edgar Lin.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel requested a plea date.  Partis were advised that as of August 1, 2015, this calendar will be transferred to the Hon. Stephanie G. Rothstein, Branch 25, in Room G55 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Court ordered all terms and conditions of bail to continue and set the matter before Branch 25.  Plea hearing scheduled for August 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Meliena Marie Zacharias in court.  James W. Frisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel did not appear; is out of the office this week.  Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  File retained in court.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 28, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Meliena Marie Zacharias in court with attorney Enku Edgar Lin.  
Sara Nicole Volden Schroeder for James Frisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Scheduling conference held between counsel.  Defense awaiting offer to convey to the defendant.  Request for adjourned scheduling date granted by the Court.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Meliena Marie Zacharias in court with attorney Enku Edgar Lin.  James W. Frisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Moroney, Branch 20.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 20.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 8, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Meliena Marie Zacharias in court with attorney Enku Edgar Lin.  Nathaniel E Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Moroney, Branch 20.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for a Preliminary Hearing in Branch PE.    DEFENDANT WAS ORDERED BY THE COURT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 3:00 P.M. ON  (06-10-2015). IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 22, 2015 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Meliena Marie Zacharias
Current: 1512 E. North Avenue, Waukesha, WI 53188 United States  (Effective: 06-09-2015)
Prior: 825 North 22nd Street Apt. 105, Milwaukee, WI 53233
SUMMONS MAILED. DEFENDANT ORDERED INTO ROOM 221 SAFETY BUILDING ON 6/9/15 @ 1:30 pm
